pros: Of course you are happy when you see the help you are giving the clients. That’s why we are here. Kevin, Angel, and Jen are amazing.
cons: The management is a mess. There is no HR. Watched a young female employee be harassed by another male employee for months. She provided screenshots of texts and emails from this coworker. The director put the man on paid leave for weeks while saying something what going to be decided eventually. The woman in the office was really treated as if it wasn’t important or a big dead until she finally quit because said other coworker was allowed to return. By the end of this mess and the fact management just ignored it until it went away… both employees left. Again… THERE IS NO HR DEPT. she was being sexually harassed by an employee twice her age. No action.

pros: I really thought that this company cared about people, but in reality it's all about the bottom line.
cons: I worked really hard to prove myself. I was hired as a packer, but did everything except deliver meals. The hiring and interview process was drawn out over the course of a month with little explanation. When I was finally hired, through a temp service, I worked really hard to prove that I was a capable, hardworking employee. After being employed for one day, they fired the operations manager whom everyone agreed was a devoted employee. After working there for four days I was called into the office by the guy who freely admitted that the guy who got fired was a hard worker, and that now it was necessary to split the duties of the fired person between three people. That should have been a red flag. The guy in charge summed the firing up as basically not copacetic with the bottom line. He asked myself and another new employee what we thought of the hiring process and HR in general. We were honest about our misgivings with the job ad not matching the actual duties we were expected to perform. He sat there and agreed about issues with how HR and the temp company handled the hiring process. The meeting was over and we went about our work until I was once again pulled into the office to be told that HR thought that I was unhappy and so I would probably continue to be unhappy . I was fired because I was honest. And also because I have feelings sometimes. I would not advise anyone to even bother applying for this job. You can be a responsible, hard worker and still get fired for being unhappy about something.

pros: Everyone that you work with is kind and mission-driven
cons: Work always comes first, the company doesn't keep anything consistent across the board. When an employee gives push back on not sacrificing their life for the job this usually leads to further questions and why things can't get done when you're already dealing with a heavy, over worked, non profit role which is under paid.

pros: The agency's mission to provide "food & friendship" is true to a point but the reality is actually quite limited.  In house staff is dedicated in their individual job responsibilities.  Administration has limited knowledge as to the real problems faced by employees dealing with difficult client situations due to constant turnover at the top.  The volunteers who deliver meals are the absolute best.
cons:
Virtually no support from Admistration to Departments & Employees who give their all but receive no recognition for same.  Salaries are stagnant and benefits have been taken from employees in recent years. Decisions that affect employees (many who have been there for 10-20 years) are made by a Board of Trustees that are not actively involved with the Agency and merely rubber stamp what those at the top want.
Administration has a number of new employees who see themselves as above the "everyday/long-term employee"

review_title: Work for a Non-Profit firm give you respective in life.
job_title: Accountant Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Great place to work and gained experience.  Twice a month the office employee have to be out deliver meals to Sr. bound senior citizen.  This give me respective in life. Great place to work if you already have everything in your life.
cons: A small office with limited managerial positions, you may not have a lot of career advancement but you do get a lot of experience.

pros: Mission driven. Teamwork encouraged. Invests in staff. Staff encouraged to deliver meals to clients which really drives home the importance of what we do every day. Good work-life balance. Transparent and responsible to staff, donors, volunteers, the board, and community supporters.
cons: The only real negative is that as Meals on Wheels is a nonprofit, the pay is what you would expect at a nonprofit. MOW is a good steward of our supporters' time and money, but it is hard to live on a nonprofit income.

pros: The volunteers are a wonderful group to work with, the work is simple and logical, feels great to make a difference in the life of seniors, management was easy-going, laid-back atmosphere, got to move around a lot
cons: It is a great job for somebody that does not want too much responsibility, however, it may be hard to move up within the company.

pros: Very dedicated staff full of drive to care for those in need.  Flexible hours and cross-training opportunities.  Benefits offered as well
cons: Low pay to start and talent pool suffers as a result.  Better paid, experienced staff would help ensure quality and safety to clients who need highest stadards.

pros: Great and motivating mission. Great culture and coworkers.
cons: Low pay compared to positions in similar organizations. Misguided and disconnected leadership team with little effort to bring lower levels along on decisions made. Little to no career growth due to size of organization and "salary bands" which limited title changes and locked employees into specific roles with capped expectations. Aggressive micromanagement from manager left team misguided and often scrambling to meet goals as manager would not hand over projects to team. Outdated tech systems and computers.

review_title: Volunteer. Delivering food packages to disadvantaged individuals and families.
pros: Helping others makes you feel good about yourself and of humanity as a whole. I always felt that my contributions to this organization truly helped. The encouragement from the other volunteers is very uplifting. The organization gives each volunteer a detailed turn-by-turn direction sheet that guides the volunteer to each destination on the route. I have never had problems finding my route drops.
cons: I never experienced any negatives or setbacks from working with this organization.

review_title: If you want to make a difference try somewhere else.
pros: The volunteers are amazing.  They really do care about the clients.
cons: Management ( with the exception of a few) only care about themselves.  Have been there to long and are only there for the pay check.  Stopped caring about the clients a long time ago.  Meals on Wheels could be so much more.

review_title: Wonderful organization keeping folks in their homes.
